user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ahc_echo:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
ahc_echo (void *cls, struct MHD_Connection *con, const char *url, const
          char *method, const char *version,
          const char *upload_data, size_t *upload_size, void **req_cls)
{
  struct Holder *holder;
  struct MHD_Response *res;
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  (void) cls;
  (void) url;
  (void) method;
  (void) version;
  (void) upload_data;
  (void) upload_size;
  if (NULL == *req_cls)
  {
    *req_cls = (void *) 1;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
  *req_cls = NULL;
  holder = calloc (1, sizeof (struct Holder));
  if (! holder)
    return MHD_NO;
  holder->file = fopen (__FILE__, "rb");
  if (NULL == holder->file)
    goto file_error;
  if (Z_OK != deflateInit (&holder->stream, Z_BEST_COMPRESSION))
    goto stream_error;
  holder->buf = malloc (CHUNK);
  if (NULL == holder->buf)
    goto buf_error;
  res = MHD_create_response_from_callback (MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN, 1024, &read_cb,
                                           holder, &free_cb);
  if (NULL == res)
    goto error;
  ret = MHD_add_response_header (res, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_ENCODING,
                                 "deflate");
  if (MHD_YES != ret)
    goto res_error;
  ret = MHD_add_response_header (res, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE, "text/x-c");
  if (MHD_YES != ret)
    goto res_error;
  ret = MHD_queue_response (con, MHD_HTTP_OK, res);
res_error:
  MHD_destroy_response (res);
  return ret;
error:
  free (holder->buf);
buf_error:
  deflateEnd (&holder->stream);
stream_error:
  fclose (holder->file);
file_error:
  free (holder);
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No controlling expressions in this function are invariant constant expressions. There are no iteration statements (for, while, do-while) at all, so Rule 14.3 (controlling expressions shall not be invariant) cannot be violated via loops. Each conditional uses a variable or a function return value, not a compile-time constant:
- if (NULL == *req_cls) — depends on *req_cls at runtime.
- if (! holder) and holder = calloc(...) — depends on the dynamic result of calloc.
- if (NULL == holder->file) and holder->file = fopen(...) — depends on fopen return.
- if (Z_OK != deflateInit(&holder->stream, ...)) — deflateInit is a function call whose return is not a compile-time constant.
- if (NULL == holder->buf) and holder->buf = malloc(...) — depends on malloc.
- if (NULL == res) and res = MHD_create_response_from_callback(...) — depends on function result.
- if (MHD_YES != ret) checks ret, which was assigned from MHD_add_response_header (a function result) or MHD_queue_response; these are runtime values, not invariants.

Given the absence of constant controlling expressions and the provided exceptions (infinite loops, and a permitted do-while pattern), there are no fragments that need investigation for Rule 14.3 in this function.
